articles.headline: Stocks Dive as Worries About Asia Reverberate
articles.snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index closed down nearly 3 percent and the Dow Jones industrial average plunged 469 points as turbulence continued.
articles.abstract: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index closed down nearly 3 percent and the Dow Jones industrial average plunged 469 points as turbulence continued.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and David Jolly

articles.headline: Obama Nears Needed Votes on Iran Nuclear Deal
articles.snippet: Bob Casey and Chris Coons, both Democrats, say they will back the accord, all but clinching victory for the agreement.
articles.abstract: Bob Casey and Chris Coons, both Democrats, say they will back the accord, all but clinching victory for the agreement.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama all but clinched victory for his Iran nuclear deal on Tuesday, as two Democratic senators threw crucial support behind the landmark accord.

articles.headline: Big Leaps for Parental Leave, if Workers Actually Take It
articles.snippet: Some companies are offering more generous paid leave, but the message from the top is ambiguous, as Marissa Mayer’s recent announcement highlights.
articles.abstract: Some companies are offering more generous paid leave, but the message from the top is ambiguous, as Marissa Mayer’s recent announcement highlights.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some corners of corporate America have a new message for new parents: Put down that laptop and pick up your baby instead.
articles.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and David Streitfeld

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Shaky Grasp on Immigration
articles.snippet: That border wall already exists, but demographics and other factors have significantly shrunk the population of Mexicans who want to cross it.
articles.abstract: That border wall already exists, but demographics and other factors have significantly shrunk the population of Mexicans who want to cross it.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Donald Trump was reaching adulthood in the mid-1960s, the United States was a less diverse place. By 1970, the share of the population born overseas had shrunk to 4.7 percent, the slimmest on record. Only about 0.4 percent of the population had been born in Mexico.

articles.headline: Union Accused of Betraying Migrant Carnival Workers
articles.snippet: Labor advocates say a guild for migrant workers is a stalking-horse for the carnival industry, not a champion for its employees.
articles.abstract: Labor advocates say a guild for migrant workers is a stalking-horse for the carnival industry, not a champion for its employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, R.I. — At summer carnivals like the Washington County Fair recently held here, migrant laborers spend long days running the Whip, the Orbiter, the Polar Express and other popular rides.

articles.headline: Uber Rebuffed by Judge in Ruling on Drivers’ Suit
articles.snippet: A lawsuit challenging the ride-hailing service’s designation of drivers as contract workers, not employees, will be heard as a class action.
articles.abstract: A lawsuit challenging the ride-hailing service’s designation of drivers as contract workers, not employees, will be heard as a class action.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge granted class-action status on Tuesday to a lawsuit that questions the employment classification of Uber drivers, paving the way for a legal challenge that could strike at the heart of the ride-hailing company’s business model.

articles.headline: Price of Crude Oil Tumbles After Soaring for 3 Days
articles.snippet: As benchmark crude fell by nearly 8 percent, ConocoPhillips said it was cutting its global work force by 10 percent, or 1,800 jobs.
articles.abstract: As benchmark crude fell by nearly 8 percent, ConocoPhillips said it was cutting its global work force by 10 percent, or 1,800 jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — After three days of spiking oil prices, a barrel of crude tumbled back nearly 8 percent on Tuesday, renewing despair in the oil patch. At the same time, ConocoPhillips announced it was cutting its global work force by 10 percent.

articles.headline: Hacking Victims Deserve Empathy, Not Ridicule
articles.snippet: Many victims of the Ashley Madison extramarital affair website breach have been plunged into despair, some even to the point of contemplating suicide.
articles.abstract: Many victims of the Ashley Madison extramarital affair website breach have been plunged into despair, some even to the point of contemplating suicide.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every day for nearly two weeks, Troy Hunt, an Australian Internet security expert, has opened up his computer to find a plea for help from someone on the edge.

articles.headline: Migrant Crisis Gives Germany Familiar Role in Another European Drama
articles.snippet: As with the Greek debt crisis, Germany once again finds itself compelled or condemned to lead by its wealth and size, and by the lack of leadership elsewhere.
articles.abstract: As with the Greek debt crisis, Germany once again finds itself compelled or condemned to lead by its wealth and size, and by the lack of leadership elsewhere.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As the standoff intensified between the Hungarian police and hundreds of migrants desperate to board trains at a Budapest rail station, the migrants took up a chant on Wednesday: “Germany! Germany!”

articles.headline: Scrutiny of Security Start-Ups May Signal Shift in Venture Funding
articles.snippet: Cybersecurity companies have had an easy time raising money in Silicon Valley over the last few years. But investors are starting to ask about profit and sustainability.
articles.abstract: Cybersecurity companies have had an easy time raising money in Silicon Valley over the last few years. But investors are starting to ask about profit and sustainability.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A funny thing happened to Orion Hindawi while he was raising $120 million for his cybersecurity start-up last month: Investors asked him about profits.

articles.headline: A Once-Sunny Jeb Bush, Bristling in the Long Shadow of Donald Trump
articles.snippet: As Mr. Trump turns the primary into a tabloid-style clash of personalities, Mr. Bush is stuck in a race that embodies what he likes least about politics.
articles.abstract: As Mr. Trump turns the primary into a tabloid-style clash of personalities, Mr. Bush is stuck in a race that embodies what he likes least about politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, N.Y. — When Jeb Bush stopped by the Hampton Synagogue here on Saturday, he was expected to offer a critique of the Iran deal and a short version of his stump speech to the Orthodox congregation.

articles.headline: Coordinated Strategy Brings Obama Victory on Iran Nuclear Deal
articles.snippet: A message from five world powers helped persuade many Democrats to back the accord, for which President Obama now has enough votes to survive Republican opposition.
articles.abstract: A message from five world powers helped persuade many Democrats to back the accord, for which President Obama now has enough votes to survive Republican opposition.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just before the Senate left town for its August break, a dozen or so undecided Democrats met in the Capitol with senior diplomats from Britain, China, France, Germany and Russia who delivered a blunt, joint message: Their nuclear agreement with Iran was the best they could expect. The five world powers had no intention of returning to the negotiating table.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and David M. Herszenhorn

articles.headline: Prison Officials Join Movement to Curb Solitary Confinement
articles.snippet: The Association of State Correctional Administrators said in a statement Wednesday that the policy of keeping inmates in solitary confinement needed to be limited or ended.
articles.abstract: The Association of State Correctional Administrators said in a statement Wednesday that the policy of keeping inmates in solitary confinement needed to be limited or ended.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a sign of how far the nation has moved from supporting solitary confinement for inmates, the leading organization for the nation’s prison and jail administrators on Wednesday called for sharply limiting or even ending its use for extended periods.
